      86              : /**
      87              :  * @return The recommended flags to be used on the current machine.
      88              :  *         Does not include:
      89              :  *            RANDOMX_FLAG_LARGE_PAGES
      90              :  *            RANDOMX_FLAG_FULL_MEM
      91              :  *            RANDOMX_FLAG_SECURE
      92              :  *         These flags must be added manually if desired.
      93              :  *         On OpenBSD RANDOMX_FLAG_SECURE is enabled by default in JIT mode as W^X is enforced by the OS.
      94              :  */
      95              : RANDOMX_EXPORT randomx_flags randomx_get_flags(void);
      96              : 
      97              : /**
      98              :  * Creates a randomx_cache structure and allocates memory for RandomX Cache.
      99              :  *
     100              :  * @param flags is any combination of these 2 flags (each flag can be set or not set):
     101              :  *        RANDOMX_FLAG_LARGE_PAGES - allocate memory in large pages
     102              :  *        RANDOMX_FLAG_JIT - create cache structure with JIT compilation support; this makes
     103              :  *                           subsequent Dataset initialization faster
     104              :  *        Optionally, one of these two flags may be selected:
     105              :  *        RANDOMX_FLAG_ARGON2_SSSE3 - optimized Argon2 for CPUs with the SSSE3 instruction set
     106              :  *                                   makes subsequent cache initialization faster
     107              :  *        RANDOMX_FLAG_ARGON2_AVX2 - optimized Argon2 for CPUs with the AVX2 instruction set
     108              :  *                                   makes subsequent cache initialization faster
     109              :  *
     110              :  * @return Pointer to an allocated randomx_cache structure.
     111              :  *         Returns NULL if:
     112              :  *         (1) memory allocation fails
     113              :  *         (2) the RANDOMX_FLAG_JIT is set and JIT compilation is not supported on the current platform
     114              :  *         (3) an invalid or unsupported RANDOMX_FLAG_ARGON2 value is set
     115              :  */
     116              : RANDOMX_EXPORT randomx_cache *randomx_alloc_cache(randomx_flags flags);
     117              : 
     118              : /**
     119              :  * Initializes the cache memory and SuperscalarHash using the provided key value.
     120              :  * Does nothing if called again with the same key value.
     121              :  *
     122              :  * @param cache is a pointer to a previously allocated randomx_cache structure. Must not be NULL.
     123              :  * @param key is a pointer to memory which contains the key value. Must not be NULL.
     124              :  * @param keySize is the number of bytes of the key.
     125              : */
     126              : RANDOMX_EXPORT void randomx_init_cache(randomx_cache *cache, const void *key, size_t keySize);
     127              : 
     128              : /**
     129              :  * Releases all memory occupied by the randomx_cache structure.
     130              :  *
     131              :  * @param cache is a pointer to a previously allocated randomx_cache structure.
     132              : */
     133              : RANDOMX_EXPORT void randomx_release_cache(randomx_cache* cache);
     134              : 
     135              : /**
     136              :  * Creates a randomx_dataset structure and allocates memory for RandomX Dataset.
     137              :  *
     138              :  * @param flags is the initialization flags. Only one flag is supported (can be set or not set):
     139              :  *        RANDOMX_FLAG_LARGE_PAGES - allocate memory in large pages
     140              :  *
     141              :  * @return Pointer to an allocated randomx_dataset structure.
     142              :  *         NULL is returned if memory allocation fails.
     143              :  */
     144              : RANDOMX_EXPORT randomx_dataset *randomx_alloc_dataset(randomx_flags flags);

     149              :  * @return the number of items contained in the dataset.

     151              : RANDOMX_EXPORT unsigned long randomx_dataset_item_count(void);
     152              : 
     153              : /**
     154              :  * Initializes dataset items.
     155              :  *
     156              :  * Note: In order to use the Dataset, all items from 0 to (randomx_dataset_item_count() - 1) must be initialized.
     157              :  * This may be done by several calls to this function using non-overlapping item sequences.
     158              :  *
     159              :  * @param dataset is a pointer to a previously allocated randomx_dataset structure. Must not be NULL.
     160              :  * @param cache is a pointer to a previously allocated and initialized randomx_cache structure. Must not be NULL.
     161              :  * @param startItem is the item number where intialization should start.
     162              :  * @param itemCount is the number of items that should be initialized.
     163              : */
     164              : RANDOMX_EXPORT void randomx_init_dataset(randomx_dataset *dataset, randomx_cache *cache, unsigned long startItem, unsigned long itemCount);
     165              : 
     166              : /**
     167              :  * Returns a pointer to the internal memory buffer of the dataset structure. The size
     168              :  * of the internal memory buffer is randomx_dataset_item_count() * RANDOMX_DATASET_ITEM_SIZE.
     169              :  *
     170              :  * @param dataset is a pointer to a previously allocated randomx_dataset structure. Must not be NULL.
     171              :  *
     172              :  * @return Pointer to the internal memory buffer of the dataset structure.
     173              : */
     174              : RANDOMX_EXPORT void *randomx_get_dataset_memory(randomx_dataset *dataset);
     175              : 
     176              : /**
     177              :  * Releases all memory occupied by the randomx_dataset structure.
     178              :  *
     179              :  * @param dataset is a pointer to a previously allocated randomx_dataset structure.
     180              : */
     181              : RANDOMX_EXPORT void randomx_release_dataset(randomx_dataset *dataset);
     182              : 
     183              : /**
     184              :  * Creates and initializes a RandomX virtual machine.
     185              :  *
     186              :  * @param flags is any combination of these 5 flags (each flag can be set or not set):
     187              :  *        RANDOMX_FLAG_LARGE_PAGES - allocate scratchpad memory in large pages
     188              :  *        RANDOMX_FLAG_HARD_AES - virtual machine will use hardware accelerated AES
     189              :  *        RANDOMX_FLAG_FULL_MEM - virtual machine will use the full dataset
     190              :  *        RANDOMX_FLAG_JIT - virtual machine will use a JIT compiler
     191              :  *        RANDOMX_FLAG_SECURE - when combined with RANDOMX_FLAG_JIT, the JIT pages are never
     192              :  *                              writable and executable at the same time (W^X policy)
     193              :  *        The numeric values of the first 4 flags are ordered so that a higher value will provide
     194              :  *        faster hash calculation and a lower numeric value will provide higher portability.
     195              :  *        Using RANDOMX_FLAG_DEFAULT (all flags not set) works on all platforms, but is the slowest.
     196              :  * @param cache is a pointer to an initialized randomx_cache structure. Can be
     197              :  *        NULL if RANDOMX_FLAG_FULL_MEM is set.
     198              :  * @param dataset is a pointer to a randomx_dataset structure. Can be NULL
     199              :  *        if RANDOMX_FLAG_FULL_MEM is not set.
     200              :  *
     201              :  * @return Pointer to an initialized randomx_vm structure.
     202              :  *         Returns NULL if:
     203              :  *         (1) Scratchpad memory allocation fails.
     204              :  *         (2) The requested initialization flags are not supported on the current platform.
     205              :  *         (3) cache parameter is NULL and RANDOMX_FLAG_FULL_MEM is not set
     206              :  *         (4) dataset parameter is NULL and RANDOMX_FLAG_FULL_MEM is set
     207              : */
     208              : RANDOMX_EXPORT randomx_vm *randomx_create_vm(randomx_flags flags, randomx_cache *cache, randomx_dataset *dataset);
     209              : 
     210              : /**
     211              :  * Reinitializes a virtual machine with a new Cache. This function should be called anytime
     212              :  * the Cache is reinitialized with a new key. Does nothing if called with a Cache containing
     213              :  * the same key value as already set.
     214              :  *
     215              :  * @param machine is a pointer to a randomx_vm structure that was initialized
     216              :  *        without RANDOMX_FLAG_FULL_MEM. Must not be NULL.
     217              :  * @param cache is a pointer to an initialized randomx_cache structure. Must not be NULL.
     218              : */
     219              : RANDOMX_EXPORT void randomx_vm_set_cache(randomx_vm *machine, randomx_cache* cache);
     220              : 
     221              : /**
     222              :  * Reinitializes a virtual machine with a new Dataset.
     223              :  *
     224              :  * @param machine is a pointer to a randomx_vm structure that was initialized
     225              :  *        with RANDOMX_FLAG_FULL_MEM. Must not be NULL.
     226              :  * @param dataset is a pointer to an initialized randomx_dataset structure. Must not be NULL.
     227              : */
     228              : RANDOMX_EXPORT void randomx_vm_set_dataset(randomx_vm *machine, randomx_dataset *dataset);
     229              : 
     230              : /**
     231              :  * Releases all memory occupied by the randomx_vm structure.
     232              :  *
     233              :  * @param machine is a pointer to a previously created randomx_vm structure.
     234              : */
     235              : RANDOMX_EXPORT void randomx_destroy_vm(randomx_vm *machine);
     236              : 
     237              : /**
     238              :  * Calculates a RandomX hash value.
     239              :  *
     240              :  * @param machine is a pointer to a randomx_vm structure. Must not be NULL.
     241              :  * @param input is a pointer to memory to be hashed. Must not be NULL.
     242              :  * @param inputSize is the number of bytes to be hashed.
     243              :  * @param output is a pointer to memory where the hash will be stored. Must not
     244              :  *        be NULL and at least RANDOMX_HASH_SIZE bytes must be available for writing.
     245              : */
     246              : RANDOMX_EXPORT void randomx_calculate_hash(randomx_vm *machine, const void *input, size_t inputSize, void *output);
     247              : 
     248              : /**
     249              :  * Set of functions used to calculate multiple RandomX hashes more efficiently.
     250              :  * randomx_calculate_hash_first will begin a hash calculation.
     251              :  * randomx_calculate_hash_next  will output the hash value of the previous input
     252              :  *                              and begin the calculation of the next hash.
     253              :  * randomx_calculate_hash_last  will output the hash value of the previous input.
     254              :  *
     255              :  * WARNING: These functions may alter the floating point rounding mode of the calling thread.
     256              :  *
     257              :  * @param machine is a pointer to a randomx_vm structure. Must not be NULL.
     258              :  * @param input is a pointer to memory to be hashed. Must not be NULL.
     259              :  * @param inputSize is the number of bytes to be hashed.
     260              :  * @param nextInput is a pointer to memory to be hashed for the next hash. Must not be NULL.
     261              :  * @param nextInputSize is the number of bytes to be hashed for the next hash.
     262              :  * @param output is a pointer to memory where the hash will be stored. Must not
     263              :  *        be NULL and at least RANDOMX_HASH_SIZE bytes must be available for writing.
     264              : */
     265              : RANDOMX_EXPORT void randomx_calculate_hash_first(randomx_vm* machine, const void* input, size_t inputSize);
     266              : RANDOMX_EXPORT void randomx_calculate_hash_next(randomx_vm* machine, const void* nextInput, size_t nextInputSize, void* output);
     267              : RANDOMX_EXPORT void randomx_calculate_hash_last(randomx_vm* machine, void* output);
     268              : 
     269              : /**
     270              :  * Calculate a RandomX commitment from a RandomX hash and its input.
     271              :  *
     272              :  * @param input is a pointer to memory that was hashed. Must not be NULL.
     273              :  * @param inputSize is the number of bytes in the input.
     274              :  * @param hash_in is the output from randomx_calculate_hash* (RANDOMX_HASH_SIZE bytes).
     275              :  * @param com_out is a pointer to memory where the commitment will be stored. Must not
     276              :  *        be NULL and at least RANDOMX_HASH_SIZE bytes must be available for writing.
     277              : */
     278              : RANDOMX_EXPORT void randomx_calculate_commitment(const void* input, size_t inputSize, const void* hash_in, void* com_out);
